info.name: Solution: Workforce360 (v1.1.1)
info.description:
This collection is a bundle of the following Use Cases:

* Use Case: PD-Base
* Use Case: PF Initial 
* Solution: Workforce - AD 
* Use Case: PC - Initial
* Use Case: Add Sample Apps
* Use Case: Add PingDataSync
* Use Case: Add PD to Workforce

Version 1.1.1 - 5/11/2020
**PingFederate**
* Added GET `/version` call to determine if API Admin account needs additional roles (v10.1+)
* Added links to the PF Admin Guide for most PF calls

Version 1.1 - 5/8/2020  

**PingDirectory**
* Modified Service Detection code in `Check if PD Server is Up` call to reduce AssertionError count
* Variablized PF Service Account Passwords
 * `pingfederate` / `pfAdminPwd`
 * `pingauditor` / `globalPwd`

**PingFederate**
* Properly variablized AD connection

* *Use Case: ActiveDirectory*
* Modified to allow P14E Connection:
 * AD PCV
 * HTML Form Adapter
 * ID-First Adapter
 * Policy Contract
 * AuthN Policies

* *Use Case: PingDirectory*
* Modified to allow P14E Connection:
 * PD PCV
 * HTML Form Adapter
 * ID-First Adapter
 * Policy Contract
 * AuthN Policies

* *Use Case: Add Sample Apps*
 * Added OAuth client for `client_credential` tokens -- `pingservices` 

**PingDataSync**
* Added `adUserContainer` to DataSync - allows you do configure what Users are synced
* Added Groups to DataSync (`adGroupContainer`)

Version 1.0
* Initial release

item.name: PD - Baseline
Check PD is Running

request.description: Uses the API endpoint instead of just the heartbeat

item.description:
This folder contains the call that's used to wait until a desired condition is met.

The `Pre-request` of the call contains a log event with a timer of 30s. The `Test Script` of the call contains the loop back to this call, and the Condition test that will break the looping.

The name of the call for the break is `00-Start-PD-Base` -- it's a simple GET request to https://postman-echo.com and allows for this to be always consistent.

The actual set of API calls for this collection are started right after this GET call.

item.name: Service Configuration
Add HTTPS Connection Handler
Add Delegated Admin to Connection Handler Copy

body.raw:
{
    "schemas": [
        "urn:pingidentity:schemas:configuration:2.0:connection-handler:http"
    ],
    "id": "HTTPS Connection Handler - PD Services",
    "meta": {
        "resourceType": "HTTP Connection Handler"
    },
    "acceptBacklog": 128,
    "allowTCPReuseAddress": true,
    "correlationIDRequestHeader": [
        "Correlation-Id",
        "X-Correlation-Id",
        "X-CorrelationID",
        "X-MS-Correlation-Id",
        "X-Request-Id",
        "X-Amzn-Trace"
    ],
    "correlationIDResponseHeader": "Correlation-Id",
    "enableMultipartMIMEParameters": false,
    "enabled": true,
    "handlerName": "HTTPS Connection Handler - PD Services",
    "httpOperationLogPublisher": [
        "HTTP Detailed Access"
    ],
    "httpRequestHeaderSize": 8192,
    "httpServletExtension": [
        "Consent",
        "Delegated Admin",
        "Directory REST API",
        "SCIM2"
    ],
    "idleTimeLimit": "3 m 20 s",
    "keepStats": true,
    "keyManagerProvider": "JKS",
    "listenPort": 2443,
    "lowResourcesConnectionThreshold": 0,
    "lowResourcesIdleTimeLimit": "3 m 20 s",
    "numRequestHandlers": 0,
    "sslCertNickname": "server-cert",
    "trustManagerProvider": "JKS",
    "useCorrelationIDHeader": true,
    "useForwardedHeaders": false,
    "useSSL": true,
    "webApplicationExtension": [
        "Console"
    ]
}

item.description:
Not part of GTE -- these calls are to create a new HTTPS Connection Handler that can be used by things other than the ConfigAPI.

This will allow changes to be made to the Handler in the ConfigAPI and allow the API to restart it
Contains the ConfigAPI calls to mimic GTE Baseline

item.name: Data Configuration
Add Initial OUs
item.description:
Create OUs for:
 * Consents
 * Groups
 * Grants
 * OAuthClients
 * People
 * Sessions

item.name: Add Initial Users (Services)
item.description:
Service Accounts \ Groups: 
* PF Administrator (PF Console)
* PF Auditor (PF Console)
* PA Account (Why does GTE do this??)
* Group - PFAdminGroup (mapped in PF `ldap.properties`)
* Group - PFAuditorGroup (mapped in PF `ldap.properties`)
* Group - PFCryptoGroup (mapped in PF `ldap.properties`)
* Group - PFUserAdminGroup (mapped in PF `ldap.properties`)

item.name: Add Initial Users (Users)
item.description:
Users \ Groups for AuthN:
* User.[0-4]
* Group.0

Contains the DirectoryAPI calls to create the data for OUs and Users:

* Configures `userBaseDN` ACIs to support PF Self-Service Reset and PD Delegated Admin
* Creates Default OUs
* Creates Service Users and Groups
* Creates Users and Groups

These calls mimic what GTE Baseline - PingDirectory does with `dsconfig` and ldif imports.

Anything that can be done via an API (Config or Dir) are here.

PD Server Profile only needs the schema folder.

item.name: PF - Initial
Check PF is Running

exec: // Checks to see if the server actually responded
// If not, run the call again (with the 30 sec delay)
// Puts a 10 sec delay into this call

request.description: Uses the API endpoint instead of just the heartbeat

item.description:
This folder contains the call that's used to wait until a desired condition is met.

The `Pre-request` of the call contains a log event with a timer of 30s. The `Test Script` of the call contains the loop back to this call, and the Condition test that will break the looping.

The name of the call for the break is `00-Start-PF-Base` -- it's a simple GET request to https://postman-echo.com and allows for this to be always consistent.

The actual set of API calls for this collection are started right after this GET call.

item.name: Initial Server Config

request.description: Gets the `userbaseDN` that was used to create the PD instance

exec: // Combine into a single number (makes the comparison easier)
// Check to see if EXPRESSION_ADMIN is needed (v10.1+)

request.description:
Used to detect the running version of PF and makes version dependant changes. 
There's a Test Script that performs the actions.

* Admin Account Role: 10.1+ needs additional Role

item.name: Update API Admin Account with version Roles

request.description:
PF 10.1+ adds a Role that is needed to use the `/config-store` API. 

This call puts the right roles onto the created Admin account
Used to configure Server Roles that match the license

https://docs.pingidentity.com/csh?Product=pf-latest&topicname=muj1564002974462.html

This is used to accept backchannel calls from other services in the stack

item.description:
This folder contains calls to do the initial configuration of the Server:

* Accept the EULA
* Add Admin account for API calls
* Match the Roles & Protocols to the installed license
* Add a Signing Certificate
* Add Extended Property
* Add Virtual Host for `pingfederate` to enable any backchannel calls

item.name: System Config - Datastore \ Config Store (PD) \ PD PCV
Create base DataStore

body.raw:
{
      "type": "LDAP",
      "id": "LDAP-PingDirectory",
      "maskAttributeValues": false,
      "hostnames": [
        "pingdirectory"
      ],
      "ldapType": "PING_DIRECTORY",
      "bindAnonymously": false,
      "userDN": "cn=pingfederate",
	  "password": "{{pfAdminPwd}}",
      "useSsl": false,
      "useDnsSrvRecords": false,
      "name": "PingDirectory",
      "testOnBorrow": false,
      "testOnReturn": false,
      "createIfNecessary": true
    }

item.description: Adds PD as a datastore

item.name: Config-Store API
Set PD for PF AuthN Sessions

item.description: Calls made using the `/config-store` API to modify the server

These calls configure the System for PingDirectory for Users and Configuration.

Adds the following:

* Datastore
* Password Credential Validator

In the `50-before-post-start.sh` hook (`/pingfed/hooks`) the values in `hivemodule.xml` are swapped out for LDAP providers. The `/config-store` API is then used to configure those providers. 

This enables PD as the store for:  

* OAuth Clients
* OAuth Grants
* PF AuthN Sessions

`config-store` API also used to:
* Enable OGNL Expressions

item.name: IDP Config
Create AuthN Policy Contracts

request.description:
https://docs.pingidentity.com/csh?Product=pf-latest&topicname=udz1564002989838.html

Creates Policy Contract that has the minimum information for O365 and PingOne for Enterprise

item.description:
A single Policy Contract is used with an **Extended Properties** Selector controlling the branch taken.

This contract is configured with the following attributes:

* `subject`
* `ImmutableID`
* `mail`
* `givenName`
* `sn`
* `memberOf`

This should be sufficient to configure connections to:
* PingOne for Enterprise
* Office365

item.name: Create Extended Property Selector - AuthN Exp

item.description:
Calls to setup the things to be used in the IDP

* PD PCV
* Default AuthN Policy Contract
* Extended Property - `authnExp`
* Extended Property Selector (`Basic` \ `MFA` \ `Passwordless`)

item.name: OAuth Config - AS Settings
Configure AS Settings

{
  "authorizationCodeTimeout": 60,

  "refreshRollingInterval": 0,

    "IMPLICIT"

    "extendedAttributes": [],

        "name": "USER_KEY"

  "allowUnidentifiedClientROCreds": false,

  "bypassActivationCodeConfirmation": false,
  "devicePollingInterval": 5,
  "userAuthorizationConsentPageSetting": "INTERNAL",
  "atmIdForOAuthGrantManagement": "",
  "scopeForOAuthGrantManagement": "",
  "allowedOrigins": [
  ],
  "trackUserSessionsForLogout": false
}

item.description: Add CORS for Delegator

Common OIDC Scopes

https://docs.pingidentity.com/csh?Product=pf-latest&topicname=rbk1564002990993.html

Creates the basic OIDC Scopes:

* openid
* address
* email
* phone
* profile
Creates a base set of scopes for OIDC and Ping integrations

item.name: Grant Mapping
Create APC mapping - Default Policy Contract

item.description:
Configuration of Grant Management

* Default AuthN Policy Contract

item.name: Token Managers
item.description:
Configures the OAuth Token Mapping settings

* Adds Default JWT Token Manager (Symmetric Key)
* Adds AuthN Policy Contract Mapping

item.name: Create JWT Token Mapping to AuthN Policy Contract
OIDC Policy
item.description:
Creates a basic OIDC Policy.

Contains only the `sub` claim

This folder contains calls to configure the AS Server:

**Scope Management**
* Common OIDC Scopes

**Grant Mapping**
* Default AuthN Policy Contract Mapping

**Access Tokens**
* JWT Access Token Manager
* Default AuthN Policy Contract Mapping

**OIDC Policy**
* Default OIDC Policy

This collection does a common base config for PingFed - these are leveraged by additional Use Cases.

The collection assumes a vanilla install of PF and will create an Admin account to be use for these calls.

* Make sure PF is running
* Initial Configs
* Configure PD as config store
* Configure Identity Provider role
* Configure OAuth Authorization Server role

item.name: Workforce - AD Authentication
Configure PF
System Config - Datastore \ Config Store
Create ActiveDirectory Config

body.raw:
{
    "type": "LDAP",
    "id": "LDAP-ActiveDirectory",
    "maskAttributeValues": false,
    "hostnames": [
        "{{adDcHost}}"
    ],
    "ldapType": "ACTIVE_DIRECTORY",
    "bindAnonymously": false,
    "userDN": "{{adServiceAccountDN}}",
    "password": "{{adServicePwd}}",
    "useSsl": false,
    "useDnsSrvRecords": false,
    "followLDAPReferrals": false,
    "name": "AD",
    "hostnamesTags": [
        {
            "hostnames": [
                "{{adDcHost}}"
            ],
            "defaultSource": true
        }
    ],
    "testOnBorrow": false,
    "testOnReturn": false,
    "createIfNecessary": true,
    "verifyHost": false,
    "minConnections": 10,
    "maxConnections": 100,
    "maxWait": -1,
    "timeBetweenEvictions": 60000,
    "readTimeout": 3000,
    "connectionTimeout": 3000,
    "binaryAttributes": [
        "ms-ds-ConsistencyGUID"
    ],
    "dnsTtl": 60000,
    "ldapDnsSrvPrefix": "_ldap._tcp",
    "ldapsDnsSrvPrefix": "_ldaps._tcp"
}

item.description:
* LDAP Datastore
* LDAP Password Credential Validator
* Kerberos Realm

These calls configure the System for PingDirectory for Users and Configuration.

Adds the following:

* Datastore
* Password Credential Validator

In the `50-before-post-start.sh` hook (`/pingfed/hooks`) the values in `hivemodule.xml` are swapped out for LDAP providers. The `/config-store` API is then used to configure those providers. 

This enables PD as the store for:  

* OAuth Clients
* OAuth Grants
* PF AuthN Sessions

item.name: IDP Config - Adapters
item.description:
These calls create the IdP Adapters:
https://docs.pingidentity.com/bundle/pingfederate-100/page/ens1564002998102.html

* Create LDAP (PD) PCV
* Add IDP Adapters:
 * HTML Form
  * PD PCV (From Use Case: PF - Initial)
  * AD PCV
 * Kerberos
 * PingID
 * Identifier-First

item.name: IDP Config - AuthN Policy pre-work
Create Selectors
Create Extended Property Selector - Main Use Cases

item.description:
Replace the Ext Properties Selector to allow for WF AuthN Policies:

* `Basic`
* `Kerberos`
* `Passwordless`

Calls to setup the things to be used in Policies and LIPs:

* Create Default AuthN Policy Contract
* Create Default Local Identity Profile
* Create HTML Form Adapter with LIP

item.name: IDP Config - Sessions
item.description:
Calls to configure the Global Sessions
* Enable Global Sessions
* Override PingID Adapter

item.name: IDP Config - Default AuthN Policy
item.description:
Creates a set of Authentication experiences:

* Basic (HTML Form --> PingID) 
* Kerberos (Kerberos)
* Passwordless (ID-First --> PingID)

An Extended Property Selector determines which path. You can configure the Application (SP Connection \ OAuth client) on the `Extended Properties` tab with the following values:

* Basic
* Kerberos
* Passwordless

PF Admin API treats all the Policies as belonging to `default` and there's no way to add new Policy Trees directly.

Since we've pre-built all the Adapters \ Policy Contracts - this uses a single call to pre-built the Policies as well

Policy Contract is fulfilled with specific data from AD to enable connections to:
* PingOne for Enterprise
* Office365

item.name: AS Config - Replace OIDC Policy
item.description: Replaces the PD lookup in the OIDC Policy.

This set of calls can be used to fully configure a new PF server

The following components will be created:  

Datastore:
* AD PCV

IdP Adapters:
* HTML Form
* Kerberos
* PingID
* ID-First

IdP AuthN Policy Contract

IdP Authentication Policy:
* Extended Properties Selector
 * Basic:  HTML Form --> PingID --> Policy Contract
 * Kerberos:  Kerberos --> HTML Form --> Policy Contract
 * Passwordless: ID-First --> PingID

IDP Sessions:
* Global Sessions: **Enabled**
* Overrides: PingID Adapter

Token Mapping:
* AuthN Policy Contract

Token Manager:
* Default JWT (Certificate)

Token Mapping:
* AuthN Policy Contract --> Default JWT

Virtual Host:
* `pingfederate`

This collection is used to configure the Workforce solution bundle with ActiveDirectory

Includes:
* ActiveDirectory Data store
* LDAP PCV (AD)
* Adapters
 * HTML Form
 * PingID
 * Kerberos
 * ID-First
* AuthN Policy
 * Basic (HTML Form + PID)
 * Kerberos (Kerberos + PID)
 * Passwordless (ID-First + PID)

item.name: Add PingCentral
PingDir Config

request.description: Gets the `userbaseDN` that was used to create the PD instance
Add PingCentral Admin to PF Admin account

item.description:
PingDir calls:

* Add `IAM-Admin` to Administrator --> `employeeType`
* Add `appowner.0` with `Application-Owner` in `employeeType`

item.name: PingFed Config

request.description:
https://docs.pingidentity.com/csh?Product=pf-latest&topicname=roj1564002966901.html

This client can be used to issue tokens for several Ping Products (using Exclusive Scopes):

* PingCentral

item.description:
PingFed calls to enable PingCentral

* Add OAuth AS CORS for PingCentral
* Creates new OIDC Policy for UserInfo results used by PingCentral
* Add `PingCentral` OIDC client (AuthZ Code)

Calls to configure PingCentral:


**PingDir**
* Uses `employeeType` for PingCentral Role
* Modifies `Administrator` with `IAM-Admin` role
* Adds `appowner.0` User - with `Application-Owner` role

* **PingFed**
* Add `PingCentral` OIDC Client
* Add `PingCentralOIDCPolicy` OIDC Policy
  * Retrieves `given_name` / `family_name` / `PingCentral-Role`

item.name: PF - Add Sample Apps
Create SP Connections

request.description:
https://docs.pingidentity.com/csh?Product=pf-latest&topicname=ikr1564002999528.html

Dummy SP Connection -- sends you to https://httpbin.org/anything

item.description: Create SP Connection that does an Authentication --> SAML Assertion to https://httpsbin.org/anything

item.name: Create OIDC Clients

request.description:
https://docs.pingidentity.com/csh?Product=pf-latest&topicname=roj1564002966901.html

This client can be used to demonstrate OIDC User AuthN (Authz Code \ Implicit) flows

body.raw:
{
      "clientId": "PingIntrospect",
      "enabled": true,
      "redirectUris": [],
      "grantTypes": [
        "ACCESS_TOKEN_VALIDATION"
      ],
      "name": "Ping Introspect",
      "description": "This client is used to Introspect and validate PF-issued access_tokens",
      "logoUrl": "",
      "refreshRolling": "SERVER_DEFAULT",
      "persistentGrantExpirationType": "SERVER_DEFAULT",
      "persistentGrantExpirationTime": 0,
      "persistentGrantExpirationTimeUnit": "DAYS",
      "persistentGrantIdleTimeoutType": "SERVER_DEFAULT",
      "persistentGrantIdleTimeout": 0,
      "persistentGrantIdleTimeoutTimeUnit": "DAYS",
      "bypassApprovalPage": false,
      "restrictScopes": false,
      "restrictedScopes": [],
      "exclusiveScopes": [],
      "restrictedResponseTypes": [],
      "defaultAccessTokenManagerRef": {
        "id": "jwtDefault"
      },
      "validateUsingAllEligibleAtms": true,
      "oidcPolicy": {
        "grantAccessSessionRevocationApi": false,
        "pingAccessLogoutCapable": false
      },
      "clientAuth": {
        "type": "SECRET",
        "secret": "{{oauthSecret}}",
        "enforceReplayPrevention": false
      },
      "extendedParameters": {},
      "deviceFlowSettingType": "SERVER_DEFAULT",
      "requireSignedRequests": false
    }

request.description:
https://docs.pingidentity.com/csh?Product=pf-latest&topicname=roj1564002966901.html

This client can be used to Introspect `access_token`

body.raw:
{
    "clientId": "PingServices",
    "enabled": true,
    "redirectUris": [],
    "grantTypes": [
        "CLIENT_CREDENTIALS"
    ],
    "name": "Ping Services",
    "description": "This client is used by Services to ask for API Tokens (Client_Credentials)",
    "refreshRolling": "SERVER_DEFAULT",
    "persistentGrantExpirationType": "SERVER_DEFAULT",
    "persistentGrantExpirationTime": 0,
    "persistentGrantExpirationTimeUnit": "DAYS",
    "persistentGrantIdleTimeoutType": "SERVER_DEFAULT",
    "persistentGrantIdleTimeout": 0,
    "persistentGrantIdleTimeoutTimeUnit": "DAYS",
    "bypassApprovalPage": true,
    "restrictScopes": false,
    "restrictedScopes": [],
    "exclusiveScopes": [],
    "restrictedResponseTypes": [],
    "defaultAccessTokenManagerRef": {
        "id": "jwtDefault"
    },
    "validateUsingAllEligibleAtms": false,
    "oidcPolicy": {
        "grantAccessSessionRevocationApi": false,
        "pingAccessLogoutCapable": false,
        "pairwiseIdentifierUserType": false
    },
    "clientAuth": {
        "type": "SECRET",
        "secret": "{{oauthSecret}}",
        "enforceReplayPrevention": false
    },
    "extendedParameters": {
        "authNexp": {}
    },
    "deviceFlowSettingType": "SERVER_DEFAULT",
    "requireProofKeyForCodeExchange": false,
    "requireSignedRequests": false
}

request.description:
https://docs.pingidentity.com/csh?Product=pf-latest&topicname=roj1564002966901.html

This client can be used to issue `client_credential` Service tokens

item.description:
Create 2 OIDC Clients

* PingLogon
 * AuthZ Code \ Implicit
* PingIntrospect
 * Introspection client

item.name: Test Use Cases
item.description:
Test to see if the connections are up:

* SAML Connection -- base64 encoded Assertion will be checked
* OIDC -- Performs a OIDC Code flow and Token Swap (requires `--ignore-redirects`)

Note: Minted tokens can be seen in the console log

Calls to generate a couple of sample applications:
* SAML
* OIDC

item.name: Add PingDataSync
Create External Servers
Add AD as an External Server
Add PD as an External Server

item.description:
Creates the Endpoints for PDS to connect to:

* ActiveDirectory (`adDcHost`) 
* PingDirectory

item.name: Create Sync Endpoints
item.description:
Creates the Sync endpoints:

* Source -- ActiveDirectory (`adBaseDN`)
* Destination -- PingDirectory (`userBaseDN`)

item.name: Create Sync Mappings
item.description:
Create Sync Mappings -- AD and PD do not use the same schema:

* AD `objectClass` is mapped to just PD `inetOrgPerson`

* DN Mapping to create PD User with `uid={sAMAccountName}`

item.name: Create Sync Pipe
item.description: Adds the Sync Pipe and associated Sync Class

item.name: Add Logging
item.description: Enables the `sync` log for the Sync Pipe

item.name: Start Sync Pipe
item.description:
Creates a Task that triggers the process:

`realtime-sync start --sync-pipe AD_Source-to-PD_Destination`

Configures DataSync

**PingDir**
* Adds an OU for Synced Users from AD (`ou=activedirectory`)

**DataSync**
* Creates the AD Source \ PD Destination
* Creates Sync Pipe with Attribute Mapping
* Creates Schedule Task to run `realtime-sync`

item.name: Add PD to Workforce

body.raw:
{
    "schemas": [
        "urn:pingidentity:schemas:configuration:2.0:plugin:pass-through-authentication"
    ],
    "enabled": "true",
    "server": "Workforce AD",
    "searchBaseDN": "{{adBaseDN}}",
    "searchFilterPattern": "(|(sAMAccountName={uid})(userPrincipalName={uid}))",
    "updateLocalPassword": true,
    "pluginName": "ActiveDirectory Pass Through Authentication Plugin"
}

item.name: Modify IdP Adapters

request.description:
https://docs.pingidentity.com/csh?Product=pf-latest&topicname=dri1564003022949.html

Replaces the AD PCV with the PD PCV

https://docs.pingidentity.com/csh?Product=pf-latest&topicname=iek1564003022460.html

Replaces the AD Lookup with a PD one

item.description:
These calls modify the existing adapters:
* HTML Form
* ID-First

* The PCV \ Lookups are moved from AD to PD
* Some attributes retrieved are different
 * `entryUUID`
 * `isMemberOf`

item.name: Modify AuthN Policy

request.description:
https://docs.pingidentity.com/csh?Product=pf-latest&topicname=qmq1564002987890.html

Swaps the HTML Form fulfillment to PD attributes

item.description:
In the AuthN Policies - replace the following attributes:

AD: `ms-ds-consistencyGuid` --> PD: `entryUUID`
AD: `userPrincipalName` --> PD: `uid`
AD: `memberOf` --> PD: `isMemberOf`

PingID --> Incoming UserID --> PD: `uid`

Configures PD as the Authoritive source:

**PingDir**
* Adds Pass-Through AuthN to AD (Synced Users)

**PingFed**
* Removes AD PCV from HTML Form
* Modifies AuthN Policy mappings to PD attributes
